reviews.review_msg: I took this course as an elective in the summer of 2024 and would recommend it to everyone. Just follow the rubric/instructions for each assignment, and you will definitely do well! The TAs are tough graders tho!

Not sure why people are giving such good rating to this prof. Took this class as an elective and ended up being more harder than courses from my major. Such tough grading and the feedback never made sense. There were no proper guidlines and format provided for assignments either. Never take a class with this prof. Worst course, prof, and TA's ever.
Engaging, and dedicated to teaching her students so that everyone gets the most out of her class.

I loved this class. It was engaging, and she clearly has a lot of expertise and passion for the subject. It was my favorite class of the week even though the lectures were 2 hours long. There were no textbook, just required readings, and the slides were made available so i could take brief personal notes and focus on engaging with her presentation

The best. She has such a caring and bubbly attitude and truly cares about her students well-being. If you can take a course with Dr. Soma, take it!!! She even brought snacks to class.The content of 357 is so applicable and so important to all of our lives. Dr. Soma is an all-round great person and is so passionate about this course and the field.

PLAN 100 fall 2022 
DO WELL ON THE ASSIGNMENTS. 
I went to maybe two lectures the whole sem and got a 87. 
tough grader on the assignments to make up for the fact that the lectures are super chill and fun, and I think we only did 3 assignments in total.  also did not take a single note in the lectures.

TAKE HER CLASS! Tammara cares the most for her students! Took this as an elective to fill upper-division credits. The is content interesting and the assignments are fun (three 500-1000 word papers/assignments)! Her lectures are engaging, she is an expert, and is making our final exam optional to lighten students' workload.

The sweetest prof ever, she is so nice and brings students candy! Lots of guest lectures, lecture content had a confusing structure and she was sort of frazzled but the lack of tests and exams made this manageable. She even cancelled our final paper. Assignments were marked hard so do well on those and participate in class for a grade booster:)

Great prof, only complains is she engages with students a little too much and then has to rush through the rest of lecture. Then again students should know when to stop talking when there no time left. I also wish we had some group work to do. Super engaging and very friendly. You can tell she put a lot of thought into her assignments and lectures.

Dr. T was awesome! You can tell how passionate she is in every lecture she posts. I'd love to take a class with her again. The course itself was fair - the marking scheme was specific and assignments were marked fairly.

Dr. T is a super passionate prof who really takes time to make sure all of her lectures are informative and easy to understand. She loves to give out bonus marks for assignments if you participate and ask questions so make sure you do !

Tammara is a great prof that cares about her students. She is super passionate about what she is teaching and you can tell that she is knowledgeable. However assignments were pretty repetitive (in this specific class), and the criteria was often not clear. TA (Tara) marks tough on every aspect of your writing, so watch out. Fun class overall.

Tammara made the class enjoyable and easy. Her recorded lectures were interesting and she was enthusiastic in them. The assignments are easy and she extended the deadlines for them a few times. There were opportunities to get bonus marks. She really cares for her students and responded to emails quickly.

Tammara is one of the best professors I have ever had! She somehow made an asynchronous class engaging and her assignments were actually fun to do! Whenever I had a question, she responded very quickly and I would recommend her to anybody!

Tammara is the most caring instructor I have had at SFU! During her recorded lectures, you can notice her enthusiasm for the class and can truly tell that she loves teaching. She also looks at things from the students' perspective. That is why she has extended the deadline for assignments a few times and also given us an extra credit assignment!
